anza1.description: Austin joined us for a summer-y picnic at Lake Anza.
anza1.title: Anza 1

anza3.description: Milo decided to stand, for the second time ever.  It's only 2 or 3 seconds right now.  It's exciting!
anza3.title: Anza 3

babysign1.description:
Another exciting first: a baby sign!

Milo made the sign for "more" (fingers tapping palm) after demolishing a slice of quiche. Of course he got more. He devoured that slice too.

Here he tries to convince Felix to share his banana.
babysign1.title: Babysign 1

babysign2.description: Felix instructs Milo on the proper execution of the sign. "See, Milo, put your fingers like this". Milo's version of the sign is more of a fist tapping open hand.   It must be helping, because Milo's "more" is getting more refined every day.
babysign2.title: Babysign 2

car2.description: Big brother privilege:  the front seat.
car2.title: Car 2

car3.description: Felix stops to pick up a branch.  Milo makes a bold move for the steering wheel.  Go for it!
car3.title: Car 3

car4.description: Ahh, Totland has a one-seater. Perfect!
car4.title: Car 4

lawn1.description:
A fearsome creature comes out of the jungle!

Actually, Milo doesn't like grass. He'll crawl out as quick as he can, keeping his knees in the air.
lawn1.title: Lawn 1

lawn2.description: Can life get any more wholesome than this?
lawn2.title: Lawn 2

music.description: Milo loves music and musical instruments.  He can use a drumstick on the tambourine and the xylophone,  he can get a few notes out of the harmonica, and he moves with the music sometimes.
music.title: Music

portrait1.description: We took some portraits for Milo's passport.
portrait1.title: Portrait 1

portrait2.description: How could any custom agent refuse to open the border to this sweetie?
portrait2.title: Portrait 2

description:
We're having gorgeous summertime weather, and are spending as much time outside as possible.

Felix got accepted to a great preschool near our house. He starts July 1st, in just five weeks! We gave notice to his old school. Appropriately, the new school is called the New School. They have rabbits and a garden and the teachers play guitar and they go on lots of field trips.

Felix is ready for the switch. He knows he's going to have to make new friends, and seems to be determined to make them anywhere he can. He's been extra friendly when we're out and about, making friends at coffee shops and playgrounds.

We visited the New School with Felix just to get him acquainted. He hung close to Lucie. At the end he said he liked it, but "it was a little scary because it was different." Now, when we walk by, he tells people on the street, "That's my new school!"
title: May 22
